column4: i've just noticed that the dapper drake install cd is compiled for i386. is there an i686 version, guys?
386 is 686, you'll just have to update the kernel if you want.
compiling the kernel for i686 doesn't provide optimal performance if all the other stuff is i386 compiled. or what do you mean by that?
you get to take advantage of the newer assembly stuff, right.  Install as 386 then install the kernel for 686, the programs are the same.
